Everyone in the film, apart from Johnny Wang, Kuan Feng and Yuen Wah are playing Cantonese comedy stereotypes that would have been very familiar to audiences at the time, perhaps a little too familiar as in they were generally played out.
 Looking and acting a lot like Jackie Chan, Meng Yuan-man is a mischievous waiter at a rural, early-20th century Chinese eatery who finds himself at odds with a petty rich guy (Lam Fai-wong).

Wang Sha, a comedy actor known previously for his roles in oddball flicks like THE CRAZY BUMPKINS and MR. FUNNY BONE is MengÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s weasely boss, who with regular plump sidekick Yeh Feng, tries unsuccessfully to please their demanding customer and his henchmen. Unskilled in kung fu, Meng enlists the aid of the restaurantÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s cook to help him fight back.

Yuen Wah, future Landlord in KUNG FU HUSTLE and acrobatic double for Bruce Lee is a fighter posing as the cook to hide from Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Pair of the Pole,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ two oddly named baddies eventually hired by Lam to beat up Meng and continue to make the restaurant ownerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s life miserable. The pole fighters are comprised of the Ã¢â‚¬Å“South Fist Iron DragonÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (Wang) and Flying Dragon the North Fist (Kuan).
